[[reply_to_current]] 56k context / 21k in / 2.9k out â€” just hit the 55k zone. Stopping research now and saving final state.

**Big find before stopping:** Discovered **Open BA** â€” a direct BA-specific competitor we hadn't seen. Pricing confirmed:
- Essentials: **$129/member/month** (10 active briefs, AI property reviews, agent outreach)
- Business: **$299/member/month** (unlimited briefs, off-portal listings, client portal, team collab)
- Enterprise: contact for pricing

Integrated with HTAG. Used by Actuate, Unicorn Buyers Agents, Marsden, Momentum, Investr, Domain & Co. Saving to HANDOFF now then you need `/new`.

arguments.content:
# HANDOFF.md â€” Session State Save
*Saved: 2026-02-22 17:13 AEDT â€” 56k tokens (55k HARD STOP triggered)*

---

## Current Task
**Competitor Research â€” BA Tech Stack, Gameplans Pricing, Open BA (NEW competitor discovered)**

---

## What Was Done This Session

### 1. MiniMax Model Confirmed Working âœ…
- Rob switched to minimax-2.5 â€” confirmed working
- Config slug `openrouter/minimax/minimax-m2.5` is correct

### 2. PropertyChat "Tools of a Buyers Agent 2023" Thread â€” FETCHED âœ…
URL: https://www.propertychat.com.au/community/threads/tools-of-a-buyers-agent-2023.73954/

**Key findings:**
- **Monday.com** â€” most popular BA CRM (free + paid versions)
- **Trello** â€” day-to-day task management
- **WhatsApp groups** â€” client comms + off-market agent deal flow
- **MailChimp** (free) + **Cellcast** (pay-per-text) â€” bulk agent outreach
- **Docusign** â€” contracts/e-signatures
- **RP Data, Pricefinder** â€” due diligence/property data
- **Chrome extension** (Homer/KoalaData via REBAA) â€” price estimates on realestate.com.au
- **Xero** â€” accounting
- **Pattern:** No dedicated BA portfolio tracker. Generic tools cobbled together. Spreadsheets fill the gap.

### 3. Gameplans Pricing â€” PARTIAL âœ…
- /pricing page broken (error)
- Strategy session pricing (what BAs charge clients): **$1,100â€“$2,200 GST incl** (Master Advocates), some charge **$2Kâ€“$5K+**
- Software subscription: **not publicly listed** â€” opaque, must book demo
- Cloudflare blocked Capterra/SoftwareAdvice review pages

### 4. NEW COMPETITOR DISCOVERED: Open BA ðŸš¨
URL: https://openba.com.au

**Critical intel â€” this is a DIRECT competitor to PropPath:**

**What it does:**
- AI automation platform specifically for Australian Buyers Agents
- Agent outreach (email, SMS, call)
- Property sourcing (on-market + off-portal/pre-market listings)
- AI property reviews scored against client brief
- Workflow automation
- Client portal (shortlist sharing + client comments)
- Team collaboration
- Daily market snapshot
- Chrome extension for sourcing
- Bulk SMS integration (add-on)
- Integrates with: **HTAG** (data), **SystemsDU**

**Pricing (CONFIRMED):**
- **Essentials: $129/member/month** â€” agent outreach, up to 10 active briefs, daily snapshot, custom domain emails, AI property reviews
- **Business: $299/member/month** â€” everything in Essentials + off-portal listings, unlimited briefs, branding, team collab, client portal (shortlist/sold), Chrome extension, bulk SMS
- **Enterprise: contact for pricing** â€” custom CRM integrations, dedicated AM, priority support, custom AI search, custom workflows

**Users (confirmed from testimonials):**
- Actuate Property (Adam Fahey) â€” also a Gameplans customer!
- Unicorn Buyers Agents (Dan Sofo) â€” 3-person team, saves 5â€“10h/week
- Marsden Buyers Agents (Dion Marsden)
- Momentum Buyers Agents (Nadene Anderson)
- Investr (JP Ghabriel)
- Buyers First Agency (Dan White)
- Domain & Co (Warwick Brookes)
- Brisbane BA managing 18+ concurrent briefs
- Veronica Morgan

**Key quotes:**
- "Reduced outreach time to agents by 30%" â€” Dan Sofo, Unicorn
- "Saves me hours every week and directly helps me generate revenue. Sourcing is my bottleneck and Open BA fixes this!" â€” JP Ghabriel
- "I was able to reduce a team member because of what it can do." â€” Warwick Brookes
- "Since coming on board, we've seen multiple success stories - outreaches that have led directly to off-market purchases" â€” Dion Marsden

**Team background:** Founders from Domain, Rokt, Airtasker, Zip

**Key differentiator vs PropPath:**
- Open BA = SOURCING + WORKFLOW (finding properties, agent outreach, pre-market access)
- PropPath = PORTFOLIO PLANNING + VISUALISATION (what to buy, when, in what order â€” the strategic layer)
- Open BA fills the acquisition execution gap; PropPath fills the portfolio strategy gap
- They are potentially COMPLEMENTARY not directly competing â€” but overlap in client portal/shortlisting

### 5. HTAG â€” Partially Researched
- Property data + analytics platform for Australian property professionals
- Has "Portfolio Modelling" feature for buyers agents
- Partnered with Open BA (integration link on Open BA site)
- Has Buyers Agent Directory (for Professional/Elite subscribers after 6 months)
- Pricing: **not yet fetched** (Cloudflare blocked)
- Services page: machine learning models covering 5,000+ local markets

### 6. RealEstateInvestar Portfolio Tracker â€” Noted
- Portfolio tracker included in all plans
- Tracks: market values, capital growth, equity, income, cash flow, expenses, tax
- Aimed at individual investors, not BAs managing client portfolios
- Pricing: see /pricing page â€” not yet fetched

---

## Key Strategic Findings

### The BA Tech Stack Map (confirmed)
| Phase | Tools Used |
|-------|-----------|
| Strategy/planning | Gameplans |
| CRM/pipeline | Monday.com, some HubSpot |
| Agent outreach | Open BA, MailChimp, Cellcast |
| Property sourcing | Open BA, HTAG, RP Data, Pricefinder |
| Client comms | WhatsApp, Open BA client portal |
| Contracts | Docusign |
| Accounting | Xero |
| **Portfolio tracking** | **NOTHING dedicated â€” spreadsheets** |

### PropPath Positioning
- Gameplans = strategy session (Phase 1)
- Open BA = acquisition execution (Phase 2 â€” sourcing/outreach)
- **PropPath = portfolio planning layer (sits between/above both)**
- PropPath should show: "what to buy next, why, and in what order" â€” the ongoing portfolio roadmap
- Open BA is NOT a direct competitor â€” they solve sourcing. PropPath solves planning.
- Potential partnership angle: Gameplans â†’ PropPath â†’ Open BA workflow

---

## Exact Next Actions (Resume Here)
1. **Fetch HTAG pricing** â€” https://www.htag.com.au/services/ (use browser, site blocks fetch)
2. **Fetch RealEstateInvestar pricing** â€” https://www.realestateinvestar.com.au/pricing
3. **Research SystemsDU** â€” Open BA integration partner, unknown what it does
4. **Update memory/knowledge/competitor_software.md** with all findings from this session
5. **Update Google Sheet** â€” CompetitorIntel + ResearchLog tabs
6. **Draft competitive positioning doc** for PropPath vs Open BA vs Gameplans

---

## Open Questions / Blockers
- HTAG pricing: unknown â€” site Cloudflare-blocked for fetch, need browser
- Gameplans software price: still unknown
- SystemsDU: unknown tool â€” needs research
- Are Actuate/Unicorn/Marsden also Gameplans users? (Actuate confirmed yes) â€” overlap of customers = validation of PropPath opportunity

content.text: State saved. Run `/new` â€” biggest find is **Open BA** ($129â€“$299/month, direct BA platform). Full breakdown in HANDOFF.
